author: The Current
description:
Watch Phil Cook's solo piano performances in The Current studio
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

After growing up playing piano and studying piano in college, the last thing Phil Cook wanted to do was play piano. “I was just angry at piano,” he recalls.

Setting the “old 88” aside, Cook embraced other instruments, notably banjo and guitar, to get as far from piano as he could. But in the grip of the pandemic, Cook found himself rediscovering the sound of — and his love for — piano. Now five years on, Cook has released a solo piano album called Appalachia Borealis, produced by his lifelong friend, Justin Vernon (he of Bon Iver).

Phil Cook visited The Current studio to play selections from 'Appalachia Borealis'; watch the performances above.

Music Performed 
00:00:00 Dawn Birds
00:03:07 Buffalo
00:05:36 Ambassador Cathedral
All music from Phil Cook’s 2025 album, 'Appalachia Borealis,' available on @psychichotline.

Musician
Phil Cook – pia
title: Phil Cook plays selections from 'Appalachia Borealis' at The Current

author: The Current
description:
Phil Cook talks about his solo piano album, 'Appalachia Borealis'
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

After growing up playing piano and studying piano in college, the last thing Phil Cook wanted to do was play piano. “I was just angry at piano,” he recalls.

Setting the “old 88” aside, Cook embraced other instruments, notably banjo and guitar, to get as far from piano as he could. But in the grip of the pandemic, Cook found himself rediscovering the sound of — and his love for — piano. Now five years on, Cook has released a solo piano album called Appalachia Borealis, produced by his lifelong friend, Justin Vernon (he of Bon Iver).

Phil Cook visited The Current studio to play selections from 'Appalachia Borealis' and to chat with The Current's Bill DeVille all about it. Watch the interview above.

Phil Cook’s 2025 album, 'Appalachia Borealis,' is available on @psychichotline.

Credits
Guest – @PhilCookMusicNC 
Host – Bill DeVille
Producer –
title: Phil Cook — interview with The Current's Bill DeVille

author: The Current
description:
Gary Louris performs "White Squirrel" from 'Dark Country'
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Best known for his work as the frontman of the longtime indie-rock band The Jayhawks, singer-songwriter Gary Louris released 'Dark Country,' his fourth solo album, on February 14, 2025.

Watch a performance of "White Squirrel" above.

Musician
Gary Louris – vocals, guitar

Credits

Host – Bill DeVille
Producer – Derrick Stevens

Digital Producer – Luke Taylor
